96.heading: Maya, Aunt.
96.title: Spider-Man : India.
96.author: [No author]
notes: "Published miniseries."

Summary (from OCLC): A "what if" story that places Spider-Man in India instead of New York. Pavitr Prabhakar is a teenager from a small village who moves to Mumbai (Bombay) for a better education. The story describes how he becomes Spider-Man, witnesses the death of his Uncle Bhim, and must fight two demonic villains for the lives of his girlfriend Meera Jain and his Aunt Maya.

119.title: "Maybe His Flea Collar Needs Changing"
119.author: Curfman.
notes: Summary: Van Gogh (the dog) has bugs buzzing around him.

120.title: "Maybe I Can Find a Sidekick on the Internet"
120.author: by Randy Hampton.
notes: Summary: Captain Spirit is a costumed superhero.
College strip, in The State News (East Lansing, Mich.).

121.title: "Maybe I Could Get Hired at a Cracker Barrel or Someting"
121.author: by Eric R
notes: Summary: Joe's big brother is finding out that being gay in the military is not the ideal situation.

122.title: "Maybe I Could Take a Suite at the Elephant House"
122.author: Tuma and Tribs.
notes: Summary: Kel-li, the panda, needs more space.

123.title: "Maybe I Should Join the Peace Corps"
123.author: by Julio Desir, Jr.
notes: Summary: Caesar's little brother has to help him fill in the forms for college.
College strip in The State News, Michigan State University.

124.title: "Maybe I Should Stick to Dancing in My Head"
124.author: Pat Byrnes.
notes: Summary: She imagines herself a ballerina, but in reality lands on her face.

125.title: "Maybe I'd Better Just Drink Hot Root Beer, Huh?"
125.author: Ketcham.
notes: Summary: Dennis is sick.

126.title: "Maybe If I'm Really Lucky I Won't Go Through Life with the Nickname 'Omlet Face'"
126.author: Watterson.
notes: Summary: Calvin contemplates stealing his truck back from Moe, but Moe's the size of a Buick.

127.title: "Maybe If You Did Your Laundry We'd Find Them Faster"
127.author: by Darrin Maurer.
notes: Summary: His keys are always in his pockets, but they're lost now and the whole apartment is covered with dirty clothes.

128.heading: "Maybe I'll Just Get a Dog Named Prince"* (Broom-Hilda, Dec.
128.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda is about to kiss a frog, when he goes into an oral hygiene lecture.
Key words: Toothbrushes, dental floss, water pics, mouthwash, lily pads.

129.title: "Maybe I'll Just Jump Into the Lake Right Here"
129.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown tries to tell Peggy Jean his name.

130.title: "Maybe I'll Use the Time to Invent a New Language and Grow a Beard"
130.author: Scott Adams.
notes: Summary: Time has stopped while the boss gets ready to deliver his bad news.

131.title: "Maybe it Bounced Out"
131.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Peter can't talk his dad into using a heavier club, fails, and ends up in the water hazard looking for the ball.

132.title: "Maybe it was the Second Left"
132.author: Guy & Brad Gilchrist.
notes: Summary: Miss Piggy is driving, and Kermit gives directions to an above-ground parking garage that take them into an office.

133.title: "Maybe It's a Burglar with a Gun or a Knife"
133.author: by Seeg.
notes: Summary: Honey wakes up hearing a noise downstairs.

134.title: "Maybe It's Trying to Run Away"
134.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Andrea's unborn baby kicks in music class, and kicks a lot when they say "Juilliard Scholarship".

135.title: "Maybe Jeremy is a Little Too Safe for Me"
135.author: Jerry Scott & Jim Borgman.
notes: Summary: Jeremy sprays Sara with pop just as she's wishing for unpredictability.

136.title: Maybe Later
136.author: Dupuy & Berberian.
notes: Translation of: Journal d'un album.

"Maybe Later sees Philippe Dupuy and Charles Berberian working separately for the first time, each cartoonist taking turns to tell the behind-the-scenes 'making of' their bestselling Mr. Jean series."

137.title: "Maybe One Doctor Isn't Enough"
137.author: by Rube Goldberg.
notes: Summary: Lala goes through the damaged net on stage, with a scream that isn't part of the show.
Clipped from a 1941 newspaper.

138.title: "Maybe, Perhaps, There's a Slight Chance We Could Start Considering Your Suggestion to Possibly Try for Another Baby"
138.author: Daniel Shelton.

139.title: Maybe Right, Maybe Wrong : a guide for young thinkers
139.author: by Dan Barker ; illustrated by Brian Strassburg.
notes: Comic books, strips, etc. 2. Human rights
Comic books, strips, etc. 3. Conduct of life
Comic books, strips, etc. I. Barker, Dan. II. Strassburg, Brian. III. Prometheus Books. Call no.: LC311.B28 1992

140.title: "Maybe She Left Them Out There to Thaw"
140.author: by Paul Gilligan.
notes: Summary: Poncho thinks the steaks were on the counter to test his willpower.

141.title: "Maybe Somebody Better Get the Lifeguard"
141.author: by Charles M
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown tries to impress the little red-haired girl by helping her with her umbrella.

142.title: "Maybe Someone Else Should Carry It"
142.author: Rickard.
notes: Summary: The wizard says where they have to take the ring, and Brewster is already using it to give people donkey ears and elephant trunks.

143.title: "Maybe the Ants will Take Pity On Us"
143.author: by Jimmy Johnson.
notes: Summary: Arlo the grasshopper finds out how much he'll need to retire: It's impossible.

144.title: "Maybe There Isn't a Pentagon After All!"
144.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Halftrack's working on a theory, but it doesn't explain who hangs up every time they phone the Pentagon.

145.title: "Maybe They Don't Like Tuna"
145.author: Paul Gilligan.
notes: Summary: He's trying to catch a spider, to help get his master back to "alpha male" status.

146.title: "Maybe They Help Them Find the Fire Hydrants"
146.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Skyler wonders why firemen have those spotted dogs.

147.title: "Maybe They'll Let Me On the Olympic Fencing Team"
147.author: by Mike Peters.
notes: Summary: Grimmy has broken through a security gate and is dragging a section of fence.

148.title: "Maybe We Already Have"
148.author: by Ed Stein.
notes: Summary: Liz and Sam compare hurricane Katrina to 9-11, and Liz says we can't go to war against nature, but Sam is thinking about global warming.

149.heading: "Maybe We Can Get A Lead from the Device"* (Judge Parker, Aug.
149.author: by Paul Nichols, Le Doux and Wilson.
notes: Summary: The bomb disposal unit says it can be defused.

150.title: "Maybe We Can Give The Rest Of This Stuff to the Church"
150.author: by Robb Armstrong.
notes: Key words: Garage sales, money, profit.

151.title: "Maybe We Can Save Someone and Be Heroes"
151.author: Jim Mooney
151.appears_in: p. 16-17 in Treasure Chest of Fun & Fact, v. 4, no. 6 (Nov. 16, 1948).
notes: Summary: Perky and Booby get to a fire before the fire department.

152.title: "Maybe We Should Call the 'Big-Ol'-Grill' Help Line!"
152.author: by Pat Brady & Don Wimmer.
notes: Summary: The men struggle to assemble the new grill, and the women order pizza.

153.heading: "Maybe We Should Have Gone with a Realtor"* (Candorville, Jan.
153.author: Darrin Bell.
notes: Summary: The apartment has a bathtub in the living room/dining area, and falling plaster.

154.title: "Maybe We Should Install Keyboards"
154.author: Scott and Borgman.
notes: Summary: His instant message list has 127 people on it, but he won't talk at the dinner table.

155.title: "Maybe We'll See Each Other Later at the Store"
155.author: Wilson and DiPreta.
notes: Summary: Spiro Timotheus and June Gale say goodbye in the hospital; a patient in a wheelchair and a nurses' station are part of the setting.

156.heading: "Maybe We're All Confused"* (Minoria, Oct. 10, 1977) / R.
156.title: Garcia. p. 12 in El Renacimiento, no. 129
156.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The characters debate whether they should call themselves Indian, Spanish, Mexican, Mexican American, just plain American, or Chicano.

157.title: Maybe Yes, Maybe No : a guide for young skeptics
157.author: Dan Barker ; illustrated by Brian Strassburg.
notes: Methodology
Comic books, strips, etc. 2. Skepticism
Comic books, strips, etc. I. Barker, Dan. II. Strassburg, Brian. III. Prometheus Books. Call no.: Q175.2.B37 1990

158.title: "Maybe You Could Sell It To A Comic Strip"
158.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Ms Buxley and Ms Blips talk about General Halftrack's sexual harrassment and the potential for a movie deal.

159.title: "Maybe You Could Smile a Little"
159.author: by Lynn Johnston.
159.series: For Better or For Worse, Mar. 17, 1990
notes: Summary: It's top-of-the-line mutt chow, but Farley won't eat anything people won't eat. Michael tries to set a good example.

160.title: "Maybe You Just Weren't Cut Out To Be A Doctor"
160.author: Lewis.
notes: Summary: Burns is observing his first operation as a medical student, and he can't look.

161.title: "Maybe You Should Feed Sarge More"
161.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Sarge is bent over eating from Otto's dog dish.

162.title: "Maybe You Should Look Into Getting a Hairpiece"
162.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: General Halftrack lands a divot on his own head, and Mrs. Halftrack likes it.

163.title: "Maybe You Should Mow One of the Lawns First"
163.author: Lynn.
163.series: For Better or For Worse, Aug. 15, 1989
notes: Summary: It's hot out and Michael needs to have a drink and cool off.

164.title: "Maybe You Should Start with the Sweepstakes Entry Forms"
164.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy's going to reorganize the office.

165.heading: "Maybe You Should Use a 'Y'"* (B.C., Sept. 23, 1992) / Hart.
165.title: reprinted on p. 90 in Comics Revue, no. 100
165.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The ball keeps falling off the tee.

166.title: "Maybe You've Got a Whistle Only Dogs Can Hear"
166.author: Art Sansom.
notes: Summary: A younger man hanging by the water cooler with Brutus is whistling at female co-workers, and they ignore him.

167.heading: Maybell, Claudius.
167.title: A History of American Graphic Humor, v. 2 (1865-1938)
167.author: William Murrell

publication info.publisher: Macmillan Company for the Whitney Museum of American Art

168.heading: Mayberry.
168.title: "If You're Gonna Play Andy of Mayberry Trivia in North Carolina, You'd Better Be Good!"
168.author: by Jake Vest
168.appears_in: reprinted (back cover) in The Bullet, Official Newsletter of the Andy Griffith Show Rerun Watchers Club, v. 6, no. 2 (Feb. 5, 1991).
notes: Summary: What was the license tag number on the wrecker the crooks were driving?

169.heading: Mayberry.

169.author: [No author]

Letter nominating issue 187 as the rarest.
